summary:
Plot idea for Captain Marvel 2 (no spoilers since I don’t know any):
After the events of Endgame, Carol finds herself caught...
body:
Plot idea for Captain Marvel 2 (no spoilers since I don’t know any):

After the events of Endgame, Carol finds herself caught between two worlds. She wants to stay at home on Earth but realizes that she needs to return to Hala, the Kree homeworld, to continue her Starforce duties. She’s both treated as an outsider on Earth due to her powers and viewed with suspicion by the Kree, leading to Carol having an identity crisis.

While on Hala, Yon-Rogg announces that they’re recruiting another Earthling with similar powers to Carol; psychologist Karla Sofen, who gained her powers after an accident involving a “moonstone”. Yon-Rogg wants Carol to help in Karla’s training since Karla might be overwhelmed by her new powers. Also, he’s hoping that with how successful Carol’s recruitment was, he’s hoping to replicate his success with Karla.

Carol and Karla start out as friends. But, tensions start to rise when Karla starts openly envying Carol’s respected status among the Starforce. Also, Karla starts becoming a threat when she develops an ego due to her powers. But things don’t start going fully crazy until it’s revealed that Karla has a dark past on Earth (her backstory is that, as a psychologist, she abused her power and drove people to suicide). Karla now wants to rule over the Kree…but first, she has to get through the Starforce.

Despite being treated differently by the Kree, Carol must now rise up to protect them from Moonstone’s rampage. But how far must Carol go to stop her? And with the Kree viewing her as a second-class citizen…are they even worth saving?

(Hint hint, that’s Carol’s character arc in the movie)

@lostinthespeedforce @angel-starbeam @whistlingwindtree @blackaquokat @isisparker

summary: Ok, I watch a lot of Marvel themed videos on YouTube, so I get recommended them as well obviously, and the amount of “Why...
body: Ok, I watch a lot of Marvel themed videos on YouTube, so I get recommended them as well obviously, and the amount of “Why Captain Marvel Will Suck” etc. videos I’ve seen is unbelievable. We’ve all seen the complaints in the comments of the trailers as well, “it looks boring” or “why won’t she smile?” or “she’s like cardboard”, but compare the marketing of the film so say, Doctor Strange or the Captain Americas or the Iron Mans and its the same? It’s an action movie, of course she’s not going to be smiling all the time, I mean she’s at war for fuck’s sake! Why do people seem to be hating on it so much? Oh wait, we know the reason don’t we? Would they be calling her a ‘Mary Sue’ and hating on it so much if the film was about Mar-Vell I wonder?

Would they be calling her a ‘Mary Sue’ and hating on it so much if the film was about Mar-Vell I wonder?

summary: i’m excited for captain marvel and it looks like it’s gonna be fun but i hate that marvel and kevin feige are basically doing...
body: i’m excited for captain marvel and it looks like it’s gonna be fun but i hate that marvel and kevin feige are basically doing this in response to wonder woman instead of just making a meaningful movie with a woman at the forefront, didn’t let a woman just fully direct the damn movie and instead put a man into it making anna boden co director as if she couldn’t be trusted with such a movie, and they’re putting it so close to endgame and therefore burying much of captain marvel’s press with press for endgame and its fucking bullshit

summary: Captain Marvel Superbowl Spot Reaction  This is a lesson to you all out there who take time in front of a camera... always check...
caption:
Captain Marvel Superbowl Spot Reaction

This is a lesson to you all out there who take time in front of a camera… always check your collar!

Anyway with the Superbowl now past us Captain Marvel aired a couple of spots and here I am taking a look at them. I am looking forward to this movie because I am a fan of Brie Larson but I still have no idea what this movie is about or what her powers are. But In Feige I trust!

#CaptainMarvel #BrieLarson #CaptainMarveltvspot

Regardless of what I may think of the TV spots which do look good I think the majority will watch this because this should tie directly into Avengers: Endgame which is the true prize :)

summary: In celebrazione della nota ricorrenza del Capodanno Cinese, la Disney, la Marvel e la Pixar hanno rilasciato una serie di poster...
body:
In celebrazione della nota ricorrenza del Capodanno Cinese, la Disney, la Marvel e la Pixar hanno rilasciato una serie di poster promozionali e celebrativi dedicati a tutti i loro film in produzione e in uscita quest’anno.

Ovviamente il desiderio di “ingraziarsi” la Cina, sopratutto per prodotti come questo piuttosto family friendly è comprensibile, visto che è velocemente diventata uno dei mercato più importanti del cinema di massa moderno (se non il più importante), in quanto spesso tendono a tirar somme davvero elevate, come dimostrano Venon e Aquaman.

Nelle immagini potete vedere raffigurati Captain Marvel, Avengers: Endgame, Dumbo, Aladdin, Il Re Leone, Frozen 2 e Toy Story 4.

Potete vederli tutti qui sotto:

Disney festeggia il Capodanno cinese con una serie di poster celebrativi In celebrazione della nota ricorrenza del Capodanno Cinese, la Disney, la Marvel e la Pixar hanno rilasciato una serie di poster promozionali e celebrativi dedicati a tutti i loro film in produzione e in uscita quest'anno.
